intro: Cordia paraguariensis, commonly known as tucumã-preto, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits containing several seeds. Its leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
